intro: Naucleopsis herrerensis, commonly known as the Herrer's nauclea, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
